title: Everyday English Course 39
description: Improve your English comprehension skills through short everyday conversations and situational dialogues.

sections.title: Section 1: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

questionTemplates.text:
W: What did you do?
M: I used to be a reporter.
W: An interesting job, wasn't it?
M: Yes, it was interesting. But I got no free time, even on weekends.
{a}

answerOptions: He doesn't like it because it kept him busy.
He doesn't like it because it is uninteresting.
He likes the job very much.
instances.correctAnswer: He doesn't like it because it kept him busy.

variables.a: How does the man feel about being a reporter?
What does the man believe?
When will the plane arrive?

questionTemplates.text:
W: Jack, you look a bit upset.
M: Yes. I saw someone in the supermarket today. He was dressed in the same clothes as me. The clothes looked so ugly.
W: Oh, that's interesting.
M: But when I went up to him, I saw it was me...myself...in the mirror!
{a}

variables.a: Why does the man feel upset?

answerOptions: He declines to join the gardening club.
He is a professional gardener in town.
He prefers to keep his gardening skills to himself.
instances.correctAnswer: He declines to join the gardening club.

variables.a: What can we infer about the man?

answerOptions: She asked the man to help her.

variables.a: What did the woman do?
Where will the woman stop on her way?

answerOptions: It's not too far for her to carry the bags.
The bus stop is just 10 minutes' walk.
She can get a taxi in 10 minutes.
instances.correctAnswer: It's not too far for her to carry the bags.

variables.a: What does the woman tell the man?
How much does the man's account have today?
When will they probably discuss the plan?

questionTemplates.text:
W: Morning, Mr. Roberts, have you been to that new shop in the High Street.
M: Good morning, Mrs. White. Yes, I just thought I pop in and browse around, seeing if there is anything I like. I must say I'm very impressed. They have a very good literature section and there is a little care where you can go and read a book in peace.
W: Have they got any nice love stories? That's what I really like, a bit of romance and excitement.
{a}

variables.a: What does the shop sell?

answerOptions: He had forgotten to bring the dictionary.
He had forgotten to tell Mr. Smith to bring the dictionary.
instances.correctAnswer: He had forgotten to tell Mr. Smith to bring the dictionary.

variables.a: Why did the man apologize?

questionTemplates.text:
M: Hi, Kate! Is your daddy at home?
W: No, Mr. Smith. He went out 10 minutes ago. Any message?
M: Hmm. Could you tell him to call me back?
W: Sure. Leave it to me.
{a}

answerOptions: A friend of the girl's father.
instances.correctAnswer: A friend of the girl's father.
